heroDescription: Hi, I'm Alejandro, freelance product designer. I research and design for people, helping companies to connect with their users.
footerDescription: If anything you saw resonates with you, I would be delighted to discuss and explore how we could create something together.

cardFreelanceElevaDescription: Website design and development for an online training company, with a modular structure and functional approach.
myHistoryOne: I have always been curious about how things work and how they can be improved. I started my professional career in marketing and soon discovered product design, a field where I could combine creativity, empathy, and problem-solving.
myHistoryTwo: My training as a designer was a self-taught and ongoing process. Through courses, books, and personal projects, I understood the importance of designing based on people's real needs. I discovered that a good product should not only look good, but also be clear, accessible, and useful.
myHistoryFour: Designing is about improving people's lives. Each project is an opportunity to add value, learn from practice, and get closer to people's lives.
article1Description: User interviews help uncover real needs, behaviors, and motivations. They reveal problems, validate ideas, and find opportunities. Success depends on well-prepared, open questions and listening without bias.
article2Description: Stakeholder interviews align expectations, reveal priorities, and identify constraints early. They provide a strategic view that complements the user perspective. Listening and turning their goals into design decisions is key.
cardExperienceOneDescription: In recent years, I have enhanced my design skills by collaborating with companies and offering ,diverse services, from document design to web design and development. I have also undertaken some entrepreneurial projects.
cardExperienceTwoDescription: Led marketing strategies at an industrial machinery company, managing and optimizing the corporate website. Created catalogs and ,technical documentation, strengthening brand identity and sector presence.

cardTestimonyDescriptionDiego: Working with Alejandro is always easy. He quickly understands what you need and knows how to connect the user’s vision with the project goals. He brings useful ideas and is happy to iterate until everything fits.
cardTestimonyDescriptionMarc: What I value most about working with Alejandro is his direct approach. He truly listens, makes suggestions with empathy, and always finds the best way to add value to the product without forgetting deadlines.
cardTestimonyDescriptionRuben: Alejandro knows how to bring his designs into real-life environments without losing the original idea. He communicates clearly with the tech team, which makes development run much smoother.
cardTestimonyDescriptionAlvaro: Alejandro has a sharp eye for spotting improvements others might miss. He combines sensitivity towards people with attention to detail, so his proposals are always well-founded.
cardTestimonyDescriptionLluis: Working with Alejandro has been inspiring. His approach is clean and functional, but he always adds a creative touch. He thinks about the whole experience, not just how it looks.

projectInfoDescriptionSixOne: Geomites is aindependent video game for mobile devices that combines exploration, creature collection, and a colorful geological setting. Its goal is to offer aaccessible and engaging experience for casual gamers, combining light narrative and simple mechanics.
projectInfoDescriptionSixTwo: The project arose as a personal initiative to apply UX design in the field of video games. I was responsible for the entire process: from the initial idea to the visual design, mechanics, and user validation.
projectInfoDescriptionSixThree: This case allowed me to explore how to apply user-centered design principles in a playful environment, facing challenges such as the visual clarity, usability, or player progression.
geomitesSectionObjectivesDescription: To build a solid product, we needed to understand both our players and the market. This phase was divided into two fronts: internal data analysis and competitor analysis.
cardObjectivesOneTitle: Consolidate a coherent and scalable visual identity
cardObjectivesOneDescription: Create a reusable design system that maintains the visual consistency of the video game and its communication across future digital media (game, networks, marketing, etc.).
cardObjectivesTwoTitle: Measurement and improvement of key metrics (KPIs)
cardObjectivesTwoDescription: Design and launch of a functional landing page to validate concept, visual style, and narrative. We analyze metrics such as conversion, content discovery, and retention to iterate improvements.
geomitesSectionDescriptionTwo: We combine actual data and market research to make informed decisions, identify opportunities, and reduce uncertainty in design.
geomitesDataAnalysisDescription: With the game underway, we implemented key metrics such as retention, average session time, and drop-off points. This data helped us identify friction points, validate hypotheses, and guide improvements to the user experience.
geomitesDataAnalysisSubsectionOneDescrip: Percentage of users who complete relevant actions (creating a profile, completing the tutorial, first battle, etc.).
geomitesDataAnalysisSubsectionTwoDescrip: Percentage of users who interact with secondary or exploratory non-mandatory content (customization menu, train geomite, craft item).
geomitesDataAnalysisSubsectionThreeDescr: This KPI measures Geomites' ability to keep users active for a given period of time.
geomitesMarketAnalysisDescription: Before making any design decisions, it is crucial to understand the market context, user expectations, and current benchmarks. Prior research allows us to design based on knowledge, not assumptions.
geomitesGameOneDescription: Combine a collection of cards (champions and spells) with progression based on levels and rarities, where players are motivated to collect, improve, and customize their battle deck.
geomitesGameTwoDescription: It features a vertical wave-based combat system, where players form a team of champions who automatically fight enemies. The strategy lies in the placement, selection, and upgrading of champions.
geomitesSectionDescriptionThree: Based on data analysis and market context, we identified key opportunities to improve the player experience. This section covers the design decisions we implemented to optimize navigation, increase conversion at key moments, and strengthen retention.
geomitesDesignDecisionsOneDescription: The interface visually highlighted key initial actions (tutorial, first battle) and organized navigation for a clear onboarding.
geomitesDesignDecisionBusinessImpactOneD: Reduced initial friction, improved early retention, and increased player continuity.
geomitesDesignDecisionsTwoDescription: A design system with reusable components and style guide was created, applying atomic design principles to ensure consistency and flexibility.
geomitesDesignDecisionBusinessImpactTwoD: Enabled faster product scaling, reduced design and development costs, and maintained a consistent visual identity across all screens.
geomitesDesignDecisionsThreeDescription: The interface organized content in progressive layers with visual indicators, applying a 'visible unlock' logic to anticipate what's coming without overwhelming the player.
geomitesDesignDecisionBusinessImpactThre: Increased motivation and engagement, promoting longer sessions and higher player retention.
geomitesDesignDecisionsFourDescription: Implemented microinteractions, smooth animations, and positive messages that reinforce player milestones in a non-intrusive way.
geomitesDesignDecisionBusinessImpactFour: Improved user satisfaction and motivation, boosting retention and increasing the likelihood of returning to the game.
geomitesSectionDescriptionFour: To iterate and quickly develop the MVP, I created a compact design system consistent with Geomites' retro-modern style. This system ensures visual consistency, facilitates collaboration with development and is scalable for future improvements, optimizing both the user experience and the design process.
geomitesSubSectionOneDescriptionFour: At Geomites, the combination of legible typography and careful wording contributes to a accessible and engaging experience. The Grenze typeface reinforces the game's visual identity, while clear and accessible language facilitates navigation and improves understanding of the gameplay.
geomitesSubSectionTwoDescriptionFour: The color palette in Geomites has been strategically reduced to prioritize the functionality and accessibility. Each shade has been selected with intention, ensuring that its use provides visual clarity and enhances the user experience.
geomitesSubSectionThreeDescriptionFour: We design and refine our own icons to give the game a unique visual identity. This customization not only reinforces aesthetic consistency, but also helps players immerse themselves more deeply in the Geomites universe.
geomitesSubSectionFourDescriptionFour: The design system includes a library of components that allows us to standardize and provide greater visual consistency for an immersive user experience. It also allows us to make quick adjustments to the settings of the game components.
geomitesSectionDescriptionFive: Thanks to continuous measurement and the application of data-driven design decisions, we observe significant improvements in three key metrics: conversion into important actions, content discovery, and user retention.
geomitesImproveFrameOneDescription: Ensure that users receive clear and engaging guidance during the onboarding process, clearly showing them how to complete key actions and encouraging them to move forward with positive, personalized messages.
geomitesImproveFrameTwoDescription: Introduce rewards or challenges to encourage users to explore additional content.
geomitesImproveFrameThreeDescription: Introduce a system of daily rewards or long-term achievement bonuses that motivate users to return.
geomitesSectionDescriptionSix: Geomites allowed me to strengthen a user-centered data-driven design approach, learning to iterate judiciously and balance creativity with product goals.
geomitesSectionDescriptionSeven: Geomites was developed in collaboration with a small technical and creative team. Working closely with them allowed me to align design, development, and product vision in an agile and coherent manner.
geomitesSectionDescriptionEight: Geomites is one of several projects where I apply strategic design and analytical thinking. Take a look around if you like and explore others in which I worked.
artisteoInfoDescriptionThree: Market research, user flows and personas, wireframes (low and high fidelity), prototyping, and development support.
artisteoInfoDescriptionSixOne: Artisteo is a marketplace that connects musical artists with people looking for music professionals for events, concerts, and other job opportunities.
artisteoInfoDescriptionSixTwo: One of the main objectives of the project is to offer a solution that artists could start using quickly and easily allowing us to launch a first functional version of the product (MVP) and, from there, iterate based on the knowledge and feedback obtained from the users themselves.
artisteoInfoDescriptionSixThree: My role as a product designer is key to defining an accessible experience from the first use, structuring clear flows and collaborating closely with the development team to ensure the technical feasibility of each decision.
artisteoSectionTitleOneFirstParagraph: In a sector as competitive as music, many artists emerging encounter significant barriers to accessing professional opportunities. At the same time, promoters, venues, and event organizers need a simple way to discover and hire talent without intermediaries or complicated processes.
artisteoSectionTitleOneSecondParagraph: Artisteo is born as a digital platform that addresses this dual need: connecting musical artists with contractors in a direct, agile, and secure way.
artisteoSectionTitleOneThirdParagraph: The project was developed within a two-month timeframe, with a practical and user-centered approach, prioritizing the delivery of a first functional version to validate the proposal as soon as possible.
artisteoSectionObjectivesDescription: The Artisteo project is intended to transform how musical artists and contractors connect and collaborate. To this end, three key objectives guide the entire development.
artisteoCardObjectivesOneTitle: Facilitate the hiring of musical artists
artisteoCardObjectivesOneDescription: Create a platform that connects musicians directly with contractors (event organizers, bars, festivals), eliminating intermediaries and making the search and hiring process more simple, fast, and transparent.
artisteoCardObjectivesTwoTitle: Launch a functional version as soon as possible (MVP)
artisteoCardObjectivesTwoDescription: Develop a minimum viable product that artists can start using immediately, with essential features to validate it in a real environment and obtain valuable insights from the start.
artisteoCardObjectivesThreeTitle: Iterate the product based on real use and feedback
artisteoCardObjectivesThreeDescription: Design the system with a flexible architecture that allows easy evolution based on learnings, real needs of users, and opportunities identified once the product is in operation
artisteoSectionResearchDescription: To design a useful, viable, and desirable solution, I approached the research phase from two complementary perspectives: on one hand, market analysis, focused on understanding how the most successful marketplaces operate; on the other, user research divided into two key groups: music professionals and contractors.
artisteoDataAnalysisDescription: I studied several of the most established marketplaces in the sector (such as Fiverr, Skool, GigSalad, or Encore), analyzing key aspects of their operation and success:
artisteoDataAnalysisPointOne: User acquisition strategies: how they generate trust and visibility for both parties (for example, through reviews, verified profiles, or payment guarantees).
artisteoDataAnalysisPointTwo: Service structure: how they present the offer, what filters and categories allow an effective search, and how they facilitate contact or hiring.
artisteoDataAnalysisPointThree: Differentiated value proposition: what makes them stand out (in some cases, the community; in others, ease of use or specialization).
artisteoGameOneInfoDescription: Scalable and accessible marketplace with a wide global reach.
artisteoGameTwoInfoDescription: Focused on learning and connecting experts with users.
artisteoGameThreeInfoDescription: Artist hiring for events, with a good filtering system.
artisteoGameFourInfoDescription: Professional focus and centered on project management.
artisteoUserResearchDescription: Based on the interviews conducted, I defined two representative profiles that helped guide the product design: artist profile and contractor profile. Each one reflects common patterns within their group and helps maintain focus on real needs throughout the entire process.
userResearchCardOneHighlight: “I want to make a living from music without relying on informal contacts or favors.”
userResearchCardOneDescription: Lucas is a passionate musician who has performed in bars, weddings, and small festivals. He has a professional style but lacks a digital platform that truly represents him. He uses social media for promotion but struggles to turn followers into contracts. He seeks visibility and a reliable channel to connect him with real opportunities.
userResearchCardTwoHighlight: “I need reliable musicians that fit each type of event, without having to do endless searches.”
userResearchCardTwoDescription: Ana organizes themed dinners and private celebrations in various venues. She has experience and good judgment but needs practical solutions. Time is key: she looks for artists that match the tone of her events without spending hours on social media or asking for recommendations. She values professionalism, punctuality, and strong references.
artisteoSectionDesignDecisionsDescriptio: During the development of Artisteo, I made a series of strategic decisions that shaped the product's visual and functional direction. Each decision responded to specific needs identified during research, aiming to balance the user experience with the project's technical feasibility.
artisteoDesignDecisionsOneDescription: A fast sign-up flow with minimal data was designed, allowing profiles to be completed progressively.
artisteoDesignDecisionBusinessImpactOneD: Reduced registration friction, increasing new user conversion and active profile creation.
artisteoDesignDecisionsTwoDescription: Filters by style, price, event, and availability were added, along with visible ratings to speed up artist discovery.
artisteoDesignDecisionBusinessImpactTwoD: Facilitated decision-making, accelerated hiring, and improved user satisfaction.
artisteoDesignDecisionsThreeTitle: Artist profiles focused on trust and talent
artisteoDesignDecisionsThreeDescription: Information was structured with featured video, verified reviews, brief description, upcoming events, and quick contact options.
artisteoDesignDecisionBusinessImpactThre: Strengthened profile credibility, driving hiring and generating greater trust in the platform.
artisteoDesignDecisionsFourDescription: Internal messaging was integrated without restrictions to enable fast agreements between artists and contractors.
artisteoDesignDecisionBusinessImpactFour: Improved communication, sped up contract closures, and increased trust in the platform.
artisteoDesignSystemSectionDescription: I focused my time and effort on building a small design system that ensured visual consistency, allowed efficient collaboration with development, was scalable, and enabled us to continuously improve the design.
artisteoBrandCreationOneDescription: The brand was created to convey professionalism, accessibility, and creativity. The logo, inspired by a triangle symbolizing artists, contractors, and the organization, is recognizable and adaptable to different sizes and applications.
artisteoBrandCreationTwoDescription: We chose Poppins for its modern, geometric, and highly legible aesthetic—qualities that perfectly align with the platform's values: clarity, accessibility, and professionalism.
artisteoBrandCreationThreeDescription: This teal-blue color palette offers an accessible and modern visual experience, acting as a neutral canvas that enhances readability and highlights content and key interactions.
artisteoBrandCreationFourDescription: The use of standard icons in Artisteo enhances the user experience by being intuitive, accessible, and aesthetically consistent with the product's visual approach.
artisteoBrandCreationFiveDescription: The design system features a component library that ensures visual consistency and allows quick adjustments. One example is the component with CTA button formats adapted to different design needs.
artisteoLearningsSectionDescription: During the development of Artisteo, I learned to move forward by prototyping, validate quickly to save time, and to value multidisciplinary collaboration, which enriches the project with diverse perspectives.
artisteoTeamSectionDescription: We are a multidisciplinary team, composed of development, design, and commercial areas. We work in a coordinated way to build a functional platform, user-centered, with a clear value proposition.
artisteoOtherProjectsSectionDescription: Artisteo is a project where I applied strategic design and a user-centered approach to solve real challenges in the music industry. Feel free to explore other projects I have worked on as well.
vivagymInfoDescriptionThree: Internal and external research, problem definition, solution proposals, and prototype design.
vivagymInfoDescriptionSixOne: Through user surveys, I detect a low usage of the VivaGym app.
vivagymInfoDescriptionSixTwo: To address this situation, I conduct a competitive analysis that allows me to identify possible solutions and define design ideas focused on improving three key KPIs.
vivagymInfoDescriptionSixThree: I always prioritize user experience and apply user-centered design methodologies to propose viable solutions and interactive prototypes that validate my decisions.
vivagymSectionTitleOneFirstParagraph: My proposal was to revitalize the VivaGym app experience by designing personalized features and motivational elements that make it easier to stick to healthy habits. This aimed to increase retention, encourage active engagement, and improve user satisfaction, directly impacting the product's key KPIs.
vivagymSectionObjectivesDescription: After analyzing user behavior and reviewing benchmark metrics, I defined three main objectives, related to improving the following metrics.
vivagymcardObjectivesOneDescription: Measures whether users are using and adopting the product (DAU/MAU, retention, adoption rate). Indicates traction and perceived value.
vivagymcardObjectivesTwoDescription: Evaluates user interaction with the product (time spent, sessions, key features). Measures appeal and usefulness.
vivagymcardObjectivesThreeDescription: Measures impact on strategic goals (conversion rate, churn, CLV). Indicates whether the product generates economic value.
vivagymSectionDescriptionThree: The research was divided into two parts: user surveys to understand their patterns, motivations, and areas for improvement, and industry benchmark analysis to identify best practices and solutions applicable to the project.
vivagymInternalAnalysisDescription: I designed a survey for VivaGym users. The goal was to understand their usage patterns, main motivations, and expectations to improve the app. Below, you can view the key findings obtained.
cardInsightVivagymFrameOneDescriptionOne: Users hardly use it beyond QR access.
cardInsightVivagymFrameTwoDescriptionOne: Add useful features (activity tracking, challenges, personalized notifications).
cardInsightVivagymFrameOneDescriptionTwo: Programs, nutrition, and invite-a-friend are barely used.
cardInsightVivagymFrameTwoDescriptionTwo: Simplify these sections and incorporate gamification elements.
cardInsightVivagymFrameOneDescriptionThr: Most users say the app does not motivate them to train more.
cardInsightVivagymFrameTwoDescriptionThr: Integrate achievements, reminders, and personalized goals.
cardInsightVivagymFrameOneDescriptionFou: Users of external apps value tracking, diet, and better usability.
cardInsightVivagymFrameTwoDescriptionFou: Progress tracking, personalized plans, and an appealing visual experience.
vivagymExternalAnalysisDescription: I analyze the market to identify best practices, inspire improvements in the user experience, and uncover opportunities for innovation in the fitness sector. I focus on the four previously identified areas of improvement, which serve as the foundation for developing the project's solutions.
vivagymAppDescriptionOne: Activity tracking, challenges, and personalized notifications that keep users motivated.
vivagymAppDescriptionTwo: Gamification with levels and rewards that makes the experience fun and engaging.
vivagymAppDescriptionThree: Achievements, reminders, and personalized goals that guide daily progress.
vivagymAppDescriptionFour: Personalized plans and progress tracking with an appealing visual experience.
vivagymSectionDescriptionFour: I transform the insights obtained into concrete design decisions, aimed at improving the user experience and aligned with the product's key KPIs: increasing usage and adoption, boosting engagement, and improving conversion and business impact.
vivagymDesignDecisionsOneDescription: I incorporate a logging and progress system to provide daily value to the app.
vivagymDesignDecisionBusinessImpactOneDe: Encourages usage and adoption, and increases user retention.
vivagymDesignDecisionsTwoDescription: I simplify and update Programs, Nutrition, and Invite-a-Friend to make them more intuitive and appealing.
vivagymDesignDecisionBusinessImpactTwoDe: Boosts engagement and strengthens user satisfaction.
vivagymDesignDecisionsThreeDescription: I integrate achievements, challenges, and personalized reminders to encourage consistency.
vivagymDesignDecisionBusinessImpactThree: Improves recurring usage and retention, positively impacting adoption.
vivagymDesignDecisionsFourDescription: I design training and nutrition plans tailored to each user's profile, goals, and level.
vivagymDesignDecisionBusinessImpactFourD: Increases conversion by providing tangible value, improves adoption, and generates long-term loyalty.
vivagymSectionDescriptionSix: The design decisions made are aimed at generating a positive and direct impact on the product's key metrics.
vivagymImpactCardDescriptionOne: By designing a tracking system and personalized plans, I make the app a useful tool in the user's daily routine. This increases usage frequency, improves retention, and reinforces perceived value.
vivagymImpactCardDescriptionTwo: By integrating motivational elements and redesigning key sections, I facilitate smoother and more engaging interactions. This encourages longer sessions, greater feature exploration, and an experience that invites users to return.
vivagymImpactCardDescriptionThree: By personalizing the offering and adding tangible value, I guide users toward clear and achievable goals. This boosts loyalty, increases satisfaction, and translates into a greater impact on strategic metrics like conversion and CLV.
vivagymSectionDescriptionSeven: Throughout the project, I gained valuable lessons that helped me grow as a product designer. These reflections summarize the most relevant aspects that shaped the process and that I can apply to future professional challenges.
vivagymSectionDescriptionEight: VivaGym is one of the projects I dedicated my time and effort to. If you want to learn more about my work, here are other projects I have contributed to.

cardPricesInfoSectionCardOneSecond: Fast, secure, and mobile-friendly pages. Your online business available on any device.
cardPricesInfoSectionCardTwoSecond: Custom designs that reflect your brand's identity and build trust.
cardPricesInfoSectionCardThreeSecond: I explain every step clearly so you always know where we're headed.
cardPricesInfoSectionCardFourSecond: I offer solutions tailored to your needs, so your website becomes a real tool for growth.

pricesFAQsDescription: I'll answer some of the most common questions that people I work with often have.
cardFAQsTitleOne: What if I'm not a tech expert?
cardFAQsDescriptionOne: I'll handle the entire process and deliver a website that's easy to manage. Plus, I'll teach you what you need to be independent in its use.
cardFAQsTitleTwo: What if I already have a website that's outdated?
cardFAQsDescriptionTwo: We can revamp it without losing your current information, improving its design, speed, and security to meet current standards.
cardFAQsTitleThree: How long will it take to get the website ready?
cardFAQsDescriptionThree: It depends on the plan and content, but most websites can be ready within 3 to 6 weeks.
cardFAQsTitleFour: Do I need to pay for monthly maintenance?
cardFAQsDescriptionFour: Not necessarily. I'll deliver the website ready to function on its own. If you'd prefer that I handle updates and support, I can offer a customized maintenance plan.
cardFAQsTitleFive: What about the domain and hosting?
cardFAQsDescriptionFive: If you don't have them yet, I'll help you choose and set up the safest and most affordable options for your business.
cardFAQsTitleSix: Is the investment really worth it?
cardFAQsDescriptionSix: A professional website isn't an expense; it's an investment. It helps you gain visibility, attract clients, and build trust. Many businesses recover their investment within the first few months.
someQuestionsSectionDescription: Don't hesitate to get in touch; I'd be happy to chat with you.
